original: FAGERBERG, Georg Andreas, Disponent, Kiruna, f Upps 19/2 80 av tågmäst C O F o Anna Lovisa Andersson, gm (2) Gunhild Hagberg. Mogenh.ex Upps 99, KTH (gruvveten-sk) 99—03. Gruvmät v Falu gruva 04, ing v Långfallsgruvan o Rvåla anrikningsverk 04 —05, v Sala silvergruva o anrikn.verk 05—06, v Witherbee, Sherman & Co Mineville NY, Oliver Iron Mining Co Coleraine Minn, Ishpe-ming Mich samt Anaconda Copper Mining Co Mont USA 06—08, geol undersökn v Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB:s gruvor Malmberget 09, bitr ing v Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB Kiruna 09—11, ing v Tuolluvaara Gruv AB Kiruna 11—12, v Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB Malmberget 12—18, l :e ing där 18—35, tf gruving i n :a bergmästaredistr 13—19, disp v Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB :s förvaltn Malmberget 36, Kiruna sed. 37. Styr.led Gällivare fortsattn.sk 28—36, styr.ordf Malmbergets komm mellansk o samrealsk 31—36, insp f samrealsk i Kiruna sed. 37, kommunalflm 35 —36. Ordf i Gällivare Malmfälts arbetares sjuk- o begravn.kassa 18—33, i lokalstyr f Luossav-Kiirunav AB :s arbetares erk centralsjukkassa 33—35. Lstomrbefh i Gällivare 15— 18. Led Sv Tekn.frn. RNO, RVO.
translated: FAGERBERG, Georg Andreas, Manager, Kiruna, born in Uppsala on February 19, 1880, son of train master C O F and Anna Lovisa Andersson, married (2) Gunhild Hagberg. Completed secondary education in Uppsala in 1899, studied mining engineering at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) from 1899 to 1903. Worked as a mine surveyor at Falun Mine in 1904, as an engineer at Långfallsgruvan and Rvåla enrichment plant from 1904 to 1905, at Sala silver mine and enrichment plant from 1905 to 1906, and at Witherbee, Sherman & Co in Mineville NY, Oliver Iron Mining Co in Coleraine Minn, Ishpeming Mich, and Anaconda Copper Mining Co in Montana, USA from 1906 to 1908. Conducted geological surveys at Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB's mines in Malmberget in 1909, worked as assistant engineer at Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB in Kiruna from 1909 to 1911, as an engineer at Tuolluvaara Gruv AB in Kiruna from 1911 to 1912, and at Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB in Malmberget from 1912 to 1918. Promoted to chief engineer there from 1918 to 1935, served as temporary mine inspector in the northern mining district from 1913 to 1919, appointed as manager of Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB's administration in Malmberget in 1936, and in Kiruna from 1937. Served as board member of Gällivare continuing school from 1928 to 1936, chairman of the board of Malmberget's middle and high school from 1931 to 1936, inspector of high school in Kiruna from 1937, and municipal film commissioner from 1935 to 1936. Also, served as chairman of Gällivare Malmfälts workers' health and funeral fund from 1918 to 1933 and in the local board of Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara AB workers' central healthcare fund from 1933 to 1935. Local military district officer in Gällivare from 1915 to 1918. Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa and the Royal Order of the North Star.

structured.name: Georg Andreas Fagerberg

memberOf.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences

awards.name: Royal Order of the North Star

structured.description: Georg Andreas Fagerberg was a Swedish manager born on February 19, 1880, in Uppsala, Sweden. He was the son of C O F and Anna Lovisa Andersson, and later married Gunhild Hagberg. Fagerberg completed his secondary education at Uppsala University in 1899 and studied mining engineering at the Royal Institute of Technology from 1899 to 1903. Throughout his career, he worked in various mining companies and held positions such as mine surveyor, engineer, assistant engineer, and chief engineer. He also conducted geological surveys and served as a temporary mine inspector. Fagerberg was actively involved in educational institutions, serving as a board member and chairman of Gällivare continuing school and Malmberget's middle and high school. He held the position of inspector of high school in Kiruna and served as the municipal film commissioner. Fagerberg was recognized for his contributions and awarded the Royal Order of Vasa and the Royal Order of the North Star.

career.workplace: Sala silver mine and enrichment plant
